Work type: Full Time Location: Brisbane Job type: Data & Analytics Applications close: Advanced Analytics Specialist Brisbane based, permanent position  Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. We’re on a mission to make flying better than ‘nice’. And to do that, it takes a team of talented people who are passionate about customer experience, doing the right thing always, with a focus on safety – in the air, on the ground and in our workplaces. A team who values real diversity and inclusion, in a big brand with big ambitions.  What you’ll be doing  We are looking for an Advanced Analytics Specialist to join our team. This exciting role has a wide variety and breadth of work. It will give you the opportunity to grow and gain great exposure to various parts of the business. The areas span across operations, commercial (airfare pricing and revenue management), econometrics, elasticity, and network optimization.  Key accountabilities  Utilize a variety of statistical and analytic methods to generate data models to help predict and explain commercial and operational trends to senior leadership and other division stakeholders. Perform ad hoc analysis to support multiple departments by compiling historical data as well as forecasting future trends. Research and evaluate industry trends, practices, and operational methodologies to continually improve overall company operational philosophy and performance. Collaborate with stakeholders to validate and improve existing assumptions and processes. Communicate informed conclusions and recommendations to senior leadership to improve business processes. Champion a culture of analytics and serve as a centre of excellence for trusted data integrity and analysis needs.  You’ll be great in this role if you…  Minimum of 4 years’ experience in Advanced Analytics Previous data science and operations research experience. Ability to take complex mathematical concepts and communicate business relevance to key business stakeholders from front-line operations up to executive level management. Ability to write database queries for successful data analysis. Use of machine learning on large data sets to identify drivers and make predictions. Creation of optimisation models to reduce cost and increase revenue. Advanced Excel based user including Power Query & PowerPivot. Modelling languages such as PowerBI, DAX, R, Python, and SQL. Ability to create various predictive and operational models as required. Simulation models including Monte Carlo and Discrete Event. Experience with EMSR optimisation and other airline operations research is highly desirable.  We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to):  Discounted flights for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year) A flexible, hybrid work style. Work from home or the office, adapt your location to suit your style and needs One of Brisbane’s most admired head office locations, with South Bank train station, a supermarket, pharmacy, and lunch options downstairs plus a 5-minute walk to the Busway, a rooftop restaurant and onsite gym (with a low membership fee) and South Bank Parklands just across the road Discounts on travel insurance, lounge membership, car hire, accommodation, and experiences worldwide Cheaper hospitality, retail, technology, beauty and wellness services Free counselling and access to a wellbeing app to support your physical, mental, social and financial health ‘Dress for Your Day’ – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever makes you feel great for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you.  When everyone is included, everyone wins  We’re all individuals. And we love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQI+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.  Ready to apply?  We’re ready to hear from you.Show moreReport

Work options: Hybrid Work from home or from one of our offices nationally Join our team of intelligent and collaborative Changemakers and make your mark on tomorrow! We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist to join our renowned Digital team, based in either Sydney, Melbourne or Brisbane! As our Senior Data Scientist, you will be an integral part of our accomplished team that will see you truly put your flair and footprint on innovative and future ready projects that will continue to benefit communities nationwide for generations to come! Digital Our Digital team works collaboratively to design and deliver innovative technology solutions that assist our clients to create a better future for our cities, regions, communities and the environment. We incorporate software development, data analytics, visualisation, digital engineering, geospatial and cloud into a truly integrated service. The Opportunity WSP Digital is the digital consulting and solutions division of WSP. We are global innovators and leaders in the integrated development and use of software to enhance our customer's engineering, infrastructure, building, and environmental projects. We are immediately looking to hire a Senior Data Scientist to grow our team across Australia - We are open and flexible for you to be based in any east coast city as we have offices nationwide. For more information on where our offices are located https://www.wsp.com/en-au/who-we-are/our-offices What will you be doing? As our Senior Data Scientist, you will be responsible for identifying, prioritising, and solving complex engineering business problems by developing advanced statistical and analytical modelling techniques, including Machine Learning, as well as developing data pipelines in order to operationalise the models into business-as-usual practice. You will also be working with a range of government and commercial clients to enhance the operation and maintenance of many critical infrastructure systems that keep our world moving - Many of our clients operate large-scale, network-based systems such as road, rail, and water supply networks, with tangible outcomes that affect us all. You will also:Work with clients to understand their needs and devise novel solutions.Collaborate with other engineering and digital disciplines, such as Digital engineering and Location Intelligence, to deliver complex multi-disciplinary projects across various engineering fields.Anticipate, characterise, and manage complex real-world data's limitations and implications, conceiving effective workarounds or alternative mitigations to deliver successful outcomes.Gain experience in taking corrective action and making tough decisions to recover or successfully implement projects.Work with massive and complex data sets from multiple sources, utilising big data tools and techniques to analyse, provide insight and validate hypotheses.Perform deep-dive analyses of experiments through reliable modelling methods that include numerous explanatory variables and covariates.Translate analytical insights into concrete, actionable recommendations for business, process, or product improvements.Make recommendations for the collection of new data or the refinement of existing data sources and storage.Collaborate with subject matter experts to deliver and solve real-world engineering problems with ML and data science.Collaborate across the business to influence change and bring ideas to life.Create solutions that will benefit the wider community.Contribute to creating a more sustainable future. What we'll love about you You will have an extensive experience as a Senior Data Scientist - experience may be a mix of corporate, industry research, government or academic, and the ability to ideate and set vision and scope for complex data-driven projects, including a deep understanding of client value-proposition and stakeholder needs. You will also posses:Understanding of core data science, machine learning and statistical concepts and methodsKnowledge and experience in AWS and/or Azure.Experience with Data Warehousing.Ability to manipulate and analyse complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data and metadata from varying sources.Passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.Proven history of successful client adoption and/or operationalisation of analytical and statistical toolsExpert knowledge of analytical tools and cloud data servicesDemonstrated knowledge of relational/structured data manipulation, machine learning, and scientific statistical analysis.Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.Analytical approach that allows for results at varying levels of precision.Strong ability to mentor junior staff.Solid understanding and experience with software engineering practice & principles.Preference for Python based software development experience About us With approximately 63,000 talented people globally and 5,500 talented people based in more than 50 offices in Australia and New Zealand, we engineer projects that will help societies grow for lifetimes to come. To find out more about working at WSP, our culture and values, WSP and please visit our website www.wsp.com What we will offer you At WSP, we provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many personal and professional development opportunities to help you deliver your best self to the role whilst balancing your personal life. We have been recognised for the second consecutive year as a Great Place to Work® with year-on-year increases in employee engagement. Some of the many benefits we offer our employees include:Flexible working hours and working from homeGlobal mobilityParental leave & purchased additional annual leaveCorporate employee discounts and offersSalary continuance insuranceWellness at work & social clubWorkplace giving /volunteeringEmployee reward & recognition programProfessional and technical development opportunities Inspired by Diversity, Driven by Inclusion… Discover a forward-thinking culture that incorporates some conventional yet non-negotiable qualities—like respect, integrity, and trust. We welcome all perspectives, strengths, skills, creeds, and genders to the table because we know that diverse ideas breed extraordinary results. If you think you have what it takes but don't meet all criteria, please still get in touch. We would love to chat and see if we can find a fit. Please note we will not be engaging the services of recruitment agencies. VideoShow moreReport

Data Analyst - Research & Insights  Job Description  As a Data Analyst with Chatbot Experience, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing the performance and effectiveness of our chatbot systems. You will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to improve user experiences, optimize chatbot interactions, and help us make informed decisions to drive customer satisfaction.  Key Responsibilities:  Collaborate with the development team to extract, transform, and load data from chatbot interactions and other relevant sources. Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in chatbot performance. Create and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and user engagement metrics. Provide insights and recommendations to improve chatbot accuracy, user satisfaction, and efficiency. Monitor and evaluate the performance of chatbot conversations, identifying areas for improvement. Implement A/B testing and experiments to optimize responses and user experiences.  Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus. Proven experience as a Data Analyst with a focus on chatbot technology. Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages, such as Python, R, or SQL. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Familiarity with chatbot development and deployment platforms.  If this sounds like your next role please apply here or contact sophieb@charterhouse.com.auShow moreReport

You will provide actionable, data-driven business and insights by combining data manipulation capabilities, business acumen and technical or operational knowledge with analysis. You will partner with data engineers and data owners from the business to define and build simple data models and integrate existing tools to automate data ingestion, data manipulation, quality control and data analysis. Applied Behavioural Scientist  VGW is a fast-growing technology company and creator of market-leading online social games. With offices around the globe, we're on a mission to be the biggest gaming company in the world!  We have a brand new role for an Applied Behavioural Scientist to join our Data Science team.  As the Applied Behavioural Scientist you will utilise your expertise in both applied quantitative and qualitative methods to work on projects that inform evidence-based product and content development and decision making. Some of these projects can include but not limited to working with teams to conduct analytics on various types of research to validate and uncover more in-depth insights that lead to hypotheses which can be used to develop features.  The successful candidate will have strong experience in statistics, A/B testing, understanding of customer research, methodology strengths and limitations and the ability to address business questions.  Note: We are open for this role to be hybrid or office-based in our Perth or Sydney office locations or remote in Australia.  Key responsibilities will include:  Able to design and run complex experiments, with an emphasis on the tradeoffs between certainty and resources like time and budget An understanding of mixed methods research, working with our internal and external research teams Work in partnership with Researchers to derive and enhance recommendations through quantitative methods Work as an advisor with Analysts and Data Scientists to refine, enhance and govern experiment design and reporting of results Building mentorship capability for the wider analytics community when it comes to experiments  What you will bring to the role:  Advanced degree in a social, quantitative or cognitive science discipline >3 years experience as a behavioural researcher/scientist in industry or consulting Demonstrated experience designing and evaluating statistical experiments (A/B/n tests) Displays a strong understanding of at least one branch of inferential statistics Strong understanding of qualitative and quantitative research skills Proficiency in Python/R and SQL Proficiency in SPSS, Qualtrics etc. Able to communicate recommendations from research and experiment designs effectively  About VGW  VGW has been disrupting the online gaming world since 2010 and we're only getting started. We've assembled an incredibly talented global team who bring their passion, energy and expertise to build games that people love.  At VGW, we have a modern approach to getting work done and a focus on creating an environment where amazing people can do amazing work. That means giving you the flexibility you need, providing spaces that will keep you comfortable and finding opportunities for you to keep learning and growing.  Find out more at www.vgw.co  If you want to join a team that does things differently apply today and we look forward to seeing what you can bring to our team.  Why VGW?  We are on a huge mission to become the biggest gaming company in the world. As we grow to meet this goal, we need talented people rich in diversity to propel us forward. We truly believe the right mix of diversity and authenticity will be our winning hand.  We are committed to creating a diverse, engaging and inclusive culture for our people to shine, with a workplace that honours your experiences, perspectives, unique identity and passions. For those reasons, we encourage you to browse our employment opportunities and apply today. Please let us know of any accommodations you may need during the application process.   #LI-CJ2 Privacy PolicyShow moreReport

Fixed Term, full-time appointment (32 months) Level B: $107,177 - $123,775 + 17% Superannuation The NPCC program is a new national palliative care project established through funding from the Australian Government Department of Health and Aged Care. The position holder will join a team of well-established investigators from across Australia that have a close relationship with the national Palliative Care Outcomes Collaboration at the University of Wollongong, and a rich knowledge of palliative care research, policy, and practice. The NPCC program is designed to help deliver a sustainable health system solution that is responsive to the increasing burden of chronic conditions by increasing (needs-based) access to palliative care, particularly for underserved populations, and improving collaboration and coordination of palliative care (e.g., between generalist and specialist palliative care). We are seeking a skilled and dedicated statistician with strong experience in designing, analysing, generating, and interpreting data to join a new national research program. Harnessing your commitment to excellence and quality, you will have an important role in shaping the future coordination of care for patients living with life-limiting illnesses and their caregivers. You will have a formal qualification in statistics or a discipline with a substantial statistical content and familiarity with statistical software packages. Competence in standard medical statistics/health service research statistics is essential. Specific skills required include statistical analysis (preferably with experience modeling administrative health data), statistical programming, and experience contributing to the preparation of reports and/or peer-reviewed research outputs. You should have, or be close to completing, a doctoral qualification with a strong mathematical/statistical component or have equivalent industry or research experience. You will be motivated and self-disciplined, possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, and be able to work both independently and as part of a multi-professional and multidisciplinary team. You will be prompted to respond to a selection criteria questionnaire as part of the application process. For further information about this position, please contact Associate Professor Barbara Daveson, NPCC Chief Investigator via email bdaveson@uow.edu.au or +61 (0) 0448 431 349 Closing Date: Sunday 19 November 2023 Note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Only candidates with valid work rights in Australia are eligible to apply. The University of Wollongong is committed to workplace equity, diversity and inclusion. We value and acknowledge the importance of our people’s diverse experiences, talents and cultures that they bring to work with them each day. Embracing diversity and creating inclusion is a key component of attracting and retaining talent in our workforce. The creation of a diverse and inclusive workforce is central to our ability to unlock potential, enhance our success and achieving our vision of being in the Top 1% of universities globally.Show moreReport

Lead Data Scientist  Permanent role as part of the wiq Team Office is Bella Vista-based with WFH flexibility - also potentially other AU locations Work as part of a collaborative team About us   Woolworths Group is an Australian food and everyday needs retailer employing 1900,000 team members across Asia Pacific, serving over 20 million customers across our brands every week. With more than 1,400 stores across Woolworths Supermarkets, Countdown Supermarkets (New Zealand) and BIG W brands, B2B business serving wholesale and export markets, and a range of fast-growing eCommerce businesses, Woolworths Group is Australia and New Zealand’s largest retailer.   We strive to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow for our customers and team, bringing the best of Woolworths Group and Quantium together to make data driven decisions. By partnering with Quantium, a world-class data science and advanced analytics business we’re excited about the future as we unlock the power of data to reimagine retail.   Through this partnership, we’ve created a new business called wiq who will harness the best of Woolworths Group and Quantium to reimagine retail by solving the most complex problems using data and analytics. As a team, we leverage Agile ways of working to help our team develop their skills while also making sure our team is focusing on solving the most complex problems for both our customers and team.   About the role   Reporting to the Head of Data Science and working closely with the wiq team and senior stakeholders across the business, you will deliver data science projects based on the strategic roadmap on time and within scope. This is a strategic, lead level role and will require leadership and mentoring of team members.   Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Lead the design, implementation and testing of data products Managing both internal and external stakeholders for resourcing the project to ensure the successful launch of new solutions. Document business requirements for the scoping design and implementation of all models. Planning long term strategy on customer data products in sync with rewards member experience. Testing and finding areas of improvement for the outputs of models and implementation of products through campaign execution through various channels. Work with various teams to ensure smooth implementation of the product. Being the single point of contact for all stakeholders to ensure the project resources are provided. Develop and maintain state of the art advanced statistical and machine learning models (GLM, Random Forests, GBM, xGBoost, DGN, etc) to drive project outcomes Directing and executing multiple mid to large analytic projects along with the rest of the stakeholders in the Data analytics space. Providing thought leadership in both using data to solve business problems and in arriving at innovative statistical solutions. Engage with business partners and work on new business cases to expand the use of modelling for data driven decision making across the board.  Who we are looking for   We are looking for an experienced Lead Data Scientist to use your in-depth knowledge of big data and cutting-edge data mining techniques as well as the use of predictive, classification and alternate analytic algorithms for modelling and segmentation, to deliver a range of exciting, data driven projects.   Requirements: 5+ years’ experience developing predictive models in commercial environments Proficiency in some of the following statistical techniques: Linear & Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forests, Markov Chains, Support Vector Machines, Neural Networks, Clustering, Principal Component Analysis, Factor analysis, etc Experienced with data analytics products and ideally big data challenges. You'll be experienced working with cross-functional and agile teams to deliver results throughout the product life cycle. Ideally experience in retail vertical markets (not essential) Experience in developing class-leading algorithms to drive commercial outcomes. Proven commercial experience in statistical and machine learning modelling, with experience manipulating and ‘making sense’ of big data from disparate systems. Advanced working knowledge of analytical programming: SQL, SAS, R or Python. Exposure to Big Data platforms, such as Hadoop and Spark. Experience with SQL essential; exposure to AWS Redshift or Teradata preferred. Experience in working in complex, multi-stakeholder environments. Experience in leading and mentoring teams of data scientists. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Tertiary qualified in a relevant discipline (Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science). Grow with the Group  As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.  We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency.  As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.  We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.  We’d love to hear from You  If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. #work180 #LI #HybridReport

Company Description  Swish Analytics is a sports analytics, betting and fantasy startup building the next generation of predictive sports analytics data products. We believe that oddsmaking is a challenge rooted in engineering, mathematics, and sports betting expertise; not intuition. We're looking for team-oriented individuals with an authentic passion for accurate and predictive real-time data who can execute in a fast-paced, creative, and continually-evolving environment without sacrificing technical excellence. Our challenges are unique, so we hope you are comfortable in uncharted territory and passionate about building systems to support products across a variety of industries and consumer/enterprise clients.  Job Description  Swish Analytics is looking for a Data Scientist to join our ever-growing team! Data Science is at the core of our business, so this team has true ownership and impact over developing core components of Swish's data products. We're hiring a Data Scientist to support our Sports Data Models.  Duties:  Ideate, develop and improve machine learning and statistical models that drive Swish's core algorithms for producing state-of-the-art sports betting products. Production support and triaging of current data science backed products. Develop contextualized feature sets using sports specific domain knowledge. Contribute to all stages of model development, from creating proof-of-concepts and beta testing, to partnering with data engineering and product teams to deploy new models. Strive to constantly improve model performance using insights from rigorous offline and online experimentation. Analyze results and outputs to assess model performance and identify model weaknesses for directing development efforts. Adhere to software engineering best practices and contribute to shared code repositories. Document modeling work and present to stakeholders and other technical and non-technical partners.  Requirements:  Bachelor degree in Data Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science or related technical subject area; Master degree highly preferred Demonstrated experience developing models at production scale for NBA, NHL, MLB, Tennis, college basketball, or college football Expertise in Probability Theory, Machine Learning, Inferential Statistics, Bayesian Statistics, Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods 4+ years of demonstrated experience developing and delivering effective machine learning and/or statistical models to serve business needs Experience with relational SQL & Python Experience with source control tools such as GitHub and related CI/CD processes Experience working in AWS environments etc Proven track record of strong leadership skills. Has shown ability to partner with teams in solving complex problems by taking a broad perspective to identify innovative solutions Excellent communication skills to both technical and non-technical audiences  Swish Analytics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All candidates who meet the qualifications will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy status, genetic, military, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. The position responsibilities are not limited to the responsibilities outlined above and are subject to change. At the employer's discretion, this position may require successful completion of background and reference checks.Show moreReport

Job no: 520191 Work type: full time Location: Sydney, NSW Categories: Analyst  Data Scientist  Employment Type: Full Time (35 hour week) Duration: Fixed Term Contract - 12 Months Remuneration: $118,883 - $133,948 (+ 17% superannuation and leave loading) Location: Kensington NSW (Hybrid Flexible Working)  About UNSW:  UNSW isn’t like other places you’ve worked. Yes, we’re a large organisation with a diverse and talented community; a community doing extraordinary things. Together, we are driven to be thoughtful, practical, and purposeful in all we do. Taking this combined approach is what makes our work matter. It’s the reason we’re one of the top 20 universities in the world and a member of Australia’s prestigious Group of Eight. If you want a career where you can thrive, be challenged and do meaningful work, you’re in the right place.   Why Your Role Matters:  The Data Scientist, Special Projects holds a key role within the Pro Vice-Chancellor Education & Student Experience (PVCESE) Innovation Pillar, responsible for analysing large and complex data sets, using statistical and machine learning techniques, to identify patterns, trends, and insights that can inform business decisions These activities will support the end-to-end planning, design and delivery of strategic educational innovation projects with the overall aim of fostering innovation and enhancing the Student Experience.  The role supports various Educational Delivery Special Projects and agile teams of Senior Education Designer to deliver approved and strategically aligned projects associated with educational solutions. This requires the identification of relevant data sources; the collection of structured and unstructured data sets and organising into usable formats; processing, cleansing and verifying the data; analysing the data for themes and patterns; designing and implementing algorithms and predictive models, and visualizing and communicating results to stakeholders and project teams; and staying up to date with emerging trends and technologies in the field.   Who You Are: Qualifications in data science, computer science, statistical mathematics or big data analytics with relevant experience in Machine/Deep learning and data visualisation, or proven equivalent competency gained through any other combination of education, training or experience. Strong technical knowledge and skills in statistical modelling, machine learning techniques (feature engineering, regression, classification, segmentation, cross validation, Bayesian techniques etc.) and deep learning modelling frameworks such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras or similar. Advanced programming skills and experience in analysing structured and unstructured big data. Proven experience in SQL, Python and PySpark are highly desirable. Proven experience and knowledge in the development and implementation of data and dimensional modelling. Proven experience in problem solving and analytical skills on processing large and complex datasets to meet business requirements within a large organisation. Proven experience and knowledge in visualizing large and complex data sets. In depth experience in Power BI is highly desirable. Proven experience and knowledge in using cloud-based ML platform, e.g., Azure ML studio and Databricks. Experience and knowledge in leveraging on Microsoft Power Platform is highly desirable. Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a collaborative and interdisciplinary environment. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build and maintain effective and constructive working relationships with colleagues; and to clearly convey ideas and information in a professional manner through presentations, written communication, high-quality analysis, submissions, reports and recommendations. High level organisational and project management skills with experience contributing to large projects in a technical capacity with a wide variety of stakeholders in a deadline driven environment. Experience working in a tertiary environment and using educational technologies including web-based learning management systems to facilitate learning a distinct advantage. An understanding of and commitment to UNSW’s aims, objectives and values in action, together with relevant policies and guidelines. Knowledge of health and safety responsibilities and commitment to attending relevant health and safety training.   How to Apply:  Please submit your CV and a Cover Letter addressing the Selection Criteria (Who you are above)   Applications close: Sunday 19 Nov - Before 11:55pm   Get in Touch:  Georgia Kelso  Talent Acquisition Coordinator  g.kelso@unsw.edu.au   UNSW is committed to equity diversity and inclusion. Applications from women, people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, those living with disabilities, members of the LGBTIQ+ community; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff. The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment. job_title: Mid Level Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer
job_description: Mid-Level Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer Rich Data Corporation Sydney, Australia Full-time Hybrid and flexible working arrangements About RDC Rich Data Co (RDC) Delivering the Future of Credit, Today! We believe credit should be accessible, fair, inclusive, and sustainable. We are passionate about AI and developing new techniques that leverage traditional and non-traditional data to get the right decision in a clear and explainable way. Global leading financial institutions are leveraging RDC’s AI decisioning platform to offer credit in a way that aligns to the customers’ needs and expectations. RDC uses explainable AI to provide banks with deeper insight into borrower behaviour, enabling more accurate and efficient lending decisions to businesses. Join the Future of Credit! Work at a 5-Star Employer of Choice 2023 - RDC was named one of HRD Australia’s “best companies to work for in Australia”. Join a fast-growing global AI company - Grow your skills, capabilities and gain AI and global experience. High performance team - Work alongside some of the best product teams, data scientists and credit experts in the industry. Vibrant team culture - Join an innovative and agile team who celebrates wins and solves problems together. Work-life balance - Highly flexible working arrangements - work how’s right for you! Financial inclusion - Be part of a company that is striving for global financial inclusion and driving the future of credit. About the Role Rich Data Co is a cloud native AI Decisioning company whose purpose is financial inclusion and increasing global access to credit. To achieve this, the Data Science function is key to our organisational success. As we look to expand in North America and grow our world-class team, we are seeking a Mid-Level Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer to join our Sydney based team. This role will work closely with our customers on developing AI based solutions to solve complex credit-based decisions in the SMB and Commercially lending space. Key Accountabilities of the Role Designing, Presenting & documenting AI based initiatives to our clients, typically banking and risk executives. Design use cases for clients with clear objectives and success criteria, matching our AI platform capabilities and client needs. Develop data processing solutions and machine learned models to address the business objective of our clients using RDC platform. Support discovery engagement and develop prototypes to be deployed on the RDC platform for clients across new use-cases in SMB and Commercial lending within ANZ/North America Support Scaling Up RDC Data Science Tooling, RDC AI R&D and AI Collaboration with universities and AI research organisations/institutes. Support sales, client advisory and client delivery team to achieve expected business outcomes as agreed with our clients. Help mentor and train more junior Data Science team members on RDC methodologies and AI best practices Your Skills & Experience As part of our strengths-based culture, we value the uniqueness of what you bring to the table and how each person’s strengths work together to form our world-class team. For the Mid-Level Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer position, candidates should have at least 6 years’ experience in the Data Science domain. You will also have an advanced degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Operation Research or Statistics, post graduate degree in relevant field preferred. You will be proficient in programming language Python and SQL. Familiarity with Pandas and Scikit-learn is required. Exposure to other languages such as R, Perl, SAS will also be beneficial. Knowledge of a wide variety of machine learning and statistical based modelling techniques is essential. You will also be comfortable working with non-traditional data sources such as transaction data, accounting data, e-commerce data. We strongly prefer candidates with real-world Banking/ Financial Services experience within Australia, New Zealand or North America. The best fit for this role is that you are already working for: A Bank or Financial services organisation within North America FinTech organisation working in the SMB domain Financial Software Company that specialises in AI i.e., Moody’s, S&P, Experian, FICO, SAS A Management Consulting Firm (eg: Oliver Wyman, PwC, E&Y, KPMG, Deloitte, Accenture) that specialises in model development. You have a broad, big-picture understanding of Credit and how it impacts businesses and can communicate with both business and technical people. You understand the challenges banks face in understanding the decision-making process behind the lending process. Strong engagement and communication skills is critical for this role. You will be comfortable engaging in conversation with Businesspeople up to Head of Data Science/Business level. What's Next? If this sounds like you, get in touch or apply now. Our Head of Talent and Capability would love to speak with you! Get ready for the #futureofcredit Please note candidates must have Australian working rights.Show moreReport

Posted 08/11/2023 Job Number 11878 Full/Part Full Time Posting End Date 01/12/2023 At Bupa, our purpose is helping people live longer, healthier, happier lives and making a better world.  Join the Healthcare Management Data Science & Insights team in this newly created role as Senior Data Scientist. Working in a passionate team of healthcare data professionals, you’ll make a direct impact by delivering advanced statistical analysis for our hospital, medical and ancillary business groups.  You will be passionate about working with data and have a background in application of statistics & machine learning techniques on data with demonstrated strengths in storytelling and presenting insights to key stakeholders focused on improving customer outcomes. Your strengths in descriptive analysis, data visualisation, coupled with exceptional influencing skills and ‘can do’ attitude will help you thrive in the role. This is a dynamic team who work flexibly, are innovative and thrive when collaborating.  This is a permanent full-time position based in our Melbourne, Brisbane or Sydney offices when you are not working from home. (Bupa offers hybrid working and you can work from the office or at home)  How will I help? Provide advanced analytics support including, machine learning and AI to Health Insurance Problems by partnering with business areas to identify and execute on use cases that will deliver value to Bupa and our customers Leverage new capabilities that become available as Bupa transitions its data from SAS to the Microsoft Azure platform Lead in-house analytics projects and upskill people across Analytics Insights & Claims Integrity as appropriate Apply your broad skillset across data and analytics to develop and implement analytical models to support key business areas such as fraud, waste and abuse, behaviour change, contract management, modelling and prediction through to interventions and health programs. Compile insights and recommendations into clear, concise deliverables for internal business partners, derive insights from data and communicate those insights to a non-technical audience through presentations and documentation. Provide guidance to other Analytics Insights & Claims Integrity members in terms of optimum approaches to problem-solving including dashboard design, critical thinking using advanced techniques such as NLP and network analysis Benefits: We keep our people smiling by helping them improve their lives in and outside of the office. We’re a welcoming lot, no matter who you are or where you’ve come from. We welcome all talents and backgrounds and embrace our differences, so you can bring your true self to work. We support our people to be the best version of themselves, physically and mentally. With a healthy work/life balance, leadership support, reduced private health cover, study leave, volunteering options and a commitment to promoting from within.  Our employees can access wide range of benefits: from our own products (incl. health insurance discounts) to many other products and services via our partnerships program (like Apple, Samsung, JB Hi-Fi, plus gym and spa discounts to name a few). We reward our people and celebrate their success, provide initiatives that develop careers and look after our people’s health, wellbeing, and futures. What do I need? As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll demonstrate advanced skills in data science, analytics or data engineering with desired experience in a Healthcare industry or insurance setting and a curiosity for solving problems through data.  Technical skills Advanced skills in statistical programming languages - SQL, SAS, R and/or Python for analyses Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau or Power BI) Proficiency and experience in statistical modelling and machine learning techniques (NLP, rule-based systems, feature engineering, regression, classification, segmentation, cross-validation, bootstrapping, Bayesian techniques etc.) Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (properties of distributions, statistical hypothesis testing, experimental design) and experience applying these. Tertiary qualifications in a highly quantitative field (mathematics, statistics, computer science, machine learning) or equivalent demonstrated work experience Structured communication skills to interpret and convey information in a clear, concise way with stakeholders from technical and non-technical background by using data to tell a story Business acumen to develop partnerships with stakeholders engaging with curiosity to deepen your business knowledge to innovate ideas to address roadblocks and create opportunities About Bupa Asia Pacific Bupa is an international healthcare group which has been committed to a purpose of helping people live longer, healthier, happier lives and making a better world for more than 70 years. Bupa Asia Pacific operates in Australia, New Zealand, and Hong Kong, supporting about 6.5 million customers through a broad range of health and care services including health insurance, aged care, dental, medical, optical, and hearing services. Employing more than 20,000 people in the region, we believe that we can make a real difference to the lives of customers through our values, purpose, and the way that we deliver personalised care.Show moreReport

job_title: Product Data Scientist - TikTok Data Analysis - Australia
job_description: Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.  Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.  About the Team The Product Data Analytics Team analyses a combination of product usage and product performance data to derive meaningful insights that would serve as a guide to better product and decision making for our business leaders. The team will work through different business scenarios including improving Live app Experiences, Host Operation, User experiences. In addition, it is important to manage the data life cycle to ensure problems are quantitatively measured to propose logical solutions.  Responsibilities:  Responsible for the data analytics work in international LIVE business, including but not limited to live gifts, host interaction, strategies, enhancing the live streaming revenue. Identify and analyse key factors driving the growth of international LIVE, and propose enhancement plans with logical data support Responsible for the design and analysis of A/B experiments, product iteration impact evaluation, marketing campaign analysis, key metrics trend analysis, etc Work with cross functional partners like Product Managers, Operations, R&D for product optimisation plans and boost business growth Perform market activity analysis and any other analytics that would help guide product and business in decision making.  Qualifications 1. Bachelor degree or above in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or other related majors; 2. At least 3 years of experiences and above; Experience in supporting analytical work of internet or large scale C2C products is preferred; 3. Proficient in SQL, skilled use of visualisation tools 4. Experience in data extraction, analysis and visualisation in a complex data environment, and have experiences in data landing to the business 5. Excellent communication skills with ability to communicate conclusions effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences, and good analysis report writing ability; 6. Strong learning ability and curiosity driven mindset, independent and possess collaborative problem solving skills  TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.  In the spirit of reconciliation, TikTok acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land, sea and community. Eastwood, Adelaide SA Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology) About Us MaxMine is looking for a Mid-level (E2) or Senior (E3) Engineer to join our data science team and grow our Analytics Engineering capability. Our platform uses large scale data pipelines, distributed systems and real-time streaming to deliver insights to our customers with completeness and accuracy. We source high rate data directly from a range of mining equipment and use carefully defined and tuned models to generate valuable data products. As an Analytics Engineer you will be responsible for developing and maintaining algorithms and models to detect, classify, and predict events across the mining domain. Examples include classifying when a truck has been loaded based on changes in suspension measurements, or classifying the behaviour of heavy excavators using only an IMU. About You You’ve demonstrated experience in data science or analytics and you’re looking for an opportunity to join a team of engineers working on tough problems. There is significant scope for learning and development, as well as the chance to meaningfully shape how we do things with new and innovative approaches. Minimum Requirements A Degree in Engineering or Computer Science degree or similar experience 1-4 years years of experience in data-science, developing data analysis and / or modelling and simulation products Experience programming with Python, or demonstrable experience in another language Preferred Working knowledge of data-science packages such as numpy, pandas, and scipy Knowledge of Machine learning approaches, in particular time-series based problems  Our Technology We work with a range of technologies across the full spectrum of dev-ops and data-science. Our platform is based on; Python, XGBoost, Pandas, SciPy, Numpy MATLAB (legacy systems) Apache Kafka, Apache Flink and MQTT streaming data systems Apache Airflow and Dagster orchestration Kubernetes (AWS EKS) & AWS Cloud About Us MaxMine is an automated business improvement product which performs advanced analytics and data science on mining operational data to deliver significant cost savings and productivity gains to global miners, with the aim of accelerating the sustainability of humanity’s scarce resources. We apply engineering science and mathematics to operational data that we collect with our hardware. We store and analyse this data via our cloud platform and deliver results straight into client’s operations. Our approach is the future of Professional Consulting Services, and everything that we do, and how we do it reflects this. We are a value focused tech company, which happens to work across Operational and Engineering domains in the Mining Services industry. With a growing client base and rapid expansion of services, analytics and operations we have a range of interesting projects which will have an impact. Our Values Our team’s cohesion and success draws from a culture of shared values. We are looking for someone who identifies with all of the following to ensure they are a good fit. Customer – We play the long game, as one team Impact – We move the needle for our customers, people & environment Ubuntu – We believe ‘I am because we are’ Finishing – We celebrate when things are done Excellence – We take pride in our work. Quality output with a sense of urgency Playful spirit – We have a good laugh What We Offer Lots of chances to learn and grow – you’ll be surrounded by some of the brightest minds in the city, part of a culture which values sharing knowledge every day Hybrid/Remote working environment A competitive compensation package A chance to join a rapidly scaling start-up Training and development budget Personal software budget The opportunity to shape your role, our team and our product Female applicants are encouraged to applyShow moreReport

About Us Committed to making a difference, InDebted was founded to change the world of consumer debt recovery for good. We're disrupting a broken industry and creating a better way for businesses to recover debt - where the customer comes first. We’re a global, digital first and customer-obsessed team of over 200 people, living and working across 11 different countries. And we’ve also recently been named the AFR BOSS Best Place to Work! By focusing on the happiness and wellbeing of our people, we’ve created a truly flexible, purpose driven and engaging workplace. We’re all here with one shared vision - to remove barriers to financial freedom for all people. About the Role Our data team at InDebted focus on developing data science models, deriving BI insights and leveraging other data driven approaches to accelerate our disruption of the traditional debt collection industry. By utilising the rich datasets we have accumulated from communicating with our customers via digital-first channels and other innovations, we are able to efficiently deliver significantly better collections performance results compared to our peers. As part of our Research and Development team, you will work along our Engineering, and Product teams to support both our internal teams as well as clients. Summary Description: We are at the forefront of revolutionising our industry by leveraging machine learning and AI models, data-driven approaches, and innovative technology to accelerate our disruption of the traditional debt collection industry. By utilising the rich datasets we have accumulated from communicating with our customers via digital-first channels and other innovations, we are able to efficiently deliver significantly better results compared to our industry peers. We are seeking a passionate and experienced Data Scientist who can leverage their skills to drive business value by improving our key success metrics. You will play a vital role in using data science and machine learning solutions to resolve complex business problems, such as enhancing customer engagement and improving collection performance. This involves end-to-end project management, ranging from the conceptualization and innovation of solutions to the sourcing and processing of data, and finally to the development, deployment, and monitoring of machine learning models. We also expect that there will be projects requiring support to develop AI solutions leveraging large language models. Duties and Responsibilities: Design, develop, and implement machine learning models or AI solutions to address business needs and improve key success metrics. Manage end-to-end machine learning project deployment and ensure seamless integration with existing systems and software. Leverage large datasets to explore, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. Monitor and maintain deployed models to ensure they continue to perform as expected. Translate complex data science concepts into digestible insights to guide data-informed business decisions. Proactively identify opportunities for, and drive, business value by leveraging state-of-the-art techniques in data science and machine learning. company: The National Film and Sound Archive (NFSA)
job_description: Posted: 06/11/2023 Closing Date: 19/11/2023 Salary: $85,168.00 - $95,084.00 Job Type: Temporary Location: Canberra or Sydney Job Category: Arts, Culture,Economics, Statistics,Information Communication Technology (ICT),Project Management,Science, Engineering, Technical The National Film and Sound Archive of Australia (NFSA) is Australia’s audiovisual cultural institution. The NFSA collection includes over 4 million items including films, television and radio programs, videos, audio recordings and video games. The collection includes contextual materials such as costumes, scripts, props, artefacts, photographs, and promotional materials. Public programs and services ensure that the collection is available for enjoyment, learning, research and for re-use by creators. In the digital age, the NFSA’s wealth of stories will be increasingly available across the country, and on demand as set out in the NFSA Strategic Direction 2022-25. The Data Scientist will be central to developing an advanced analytics portal and a suite of SQL-based reports. Core duties include leading data projects and fortifying data integrity through robust governance. Employing modern analytical tools, you'll turn complex data into insights that drive key business decisions. The ideal candidate excels in analysing; large, complex datasets, ideally within a Cultural Institution, and collaborates effectively with stakeholders for holistic data reporting across digital platforms.  Job Description The successful candidate will be responsible for undertaking the following duties: Leads efforts in collection, analysing, modelling, and visualising key NFSA data to generate actionable reports and insights. Specialise in crafting and sustaining SQL-based reporting systems. Coordinates with software engineering teams to facilitate the migration of data into centralised Data Warehouses or Data Lakes. Enhance Business Intelligence by refining KPI tracking tools and methods for trend analysis. Participate in initiatives to improve data and metadata quality and supports the establishment of governance frameworks for data security and integrity. Act as the analytics liaison among teams, SMEs, and executive staff, aligning data reporting and analytical efforts.  Selection Criteria In relation to the ‘Job Details’ listed above, concisely demonstrate your skills, experience, and achievements against each of the following areas: Experience in leading data-related projects and analytics initiatives. Proficiency in SQL and data reporting techniques. Familiarity with coordinating data migration projects. Skills in contributing to Business Intelligence, including KPI tracking and trend analysis. Strong communication skills for stakeholder engagement across various organisational levels. Ability to mentor and advise team members in technical aspects of data management.  Desired Skills and Experience Qualifications and/or equivalent experience Required: Experience in data analysis, management, and scripting, backed by relevant education or industry credentials. Teamwork skills with strong communication abilities. Familiarity with SQL/Python code management. Technical writing skills, including creating queries and reports. Knowledge of server languages like Python, NodeJs, or PHP.  Desirable: Experience with data visualisation tools like Jupyter or PowerBI is a plus. Experience with R or similar for analysis and modelling. Knowledge of DAMS/MAMS/CMS and CRMs is a plus.  Assessment Process The assessment process for this position will include: A written statement of claims of up two pages setting out your experience against the selection criteria; Resume; and Referee checking.  Eligibility To be eligible for this position you must: Be an Australian Citizen; Obtain and maintain an Australian Government Baseline Security Clearance; and Satisfactorily complete an Australian Federal Police National Police Check.  We welcome and encourage applications from people with disability, the LGBTIQ+ communities, from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people, and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. The National Film and Sound Archive of Australia is committed to ensuring a child-safe and child-friendly environment. All employees are expected to demonstrate a commitment to, and support for these principles in theory and practice. Contact Officer Jennifer Drysdale | Manager, Data Integrity and Analytics and Information Management Jennifer.Drysdale@nfsa.gov.au 02 6248 2270Show moreReport

Description  Founded by deep AI and data science experts, Data Science Group (DSG) is a global leader in AI technologies, specializing in cutting-edge AI technology solutions as well as AI governance, auditing, monitoring, and performance management solutions. Headquartered in Tel Aviv, Israel, our roots lie deep in the tech business culture of innovation and research, and its translation to tangible business value.  The DSG Australia team is a group of AI and transformation specialists passionate about supporting large businesses through their journey of innovating, scaling, and transforming with AI.  We are continually fuelled by the opportunities to solve some of the most complex issues challenging businesses today as they venture into the ever-evolving age of AI.  As a Data Science and Analytics Consultant at DSG Australia, you will work with clients to design their AI processes and governance procedures, develop innovative solutions to complex business challenges, provide strategic guidance on leveraging data and machine learning technologies to drive business outcomes, and design and implement data-driven solutions. You will be responsible for delivering successful outcomes while maintaining strong relationships with clients and stakeholders.  As DSG Australia grows its footprint in Australia and APAC, this is a great opportunity for you as a data scientist to join a fast-growing start-up and broaden your skills and professional experience.  Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with clients and stakeholders to understand their business challenges and objectives and design data-driven solutions to address them. Provide clients with strategic guidance and leadership on varied data science and analytics topics. This includes leveraging data to drive growth and competitive advantage while reducing operational risk through disciplined AI processes and governance procedures. Lead end-to-end data science and analytics projects, including problem definition, data preparation modelling, and deployment. Build predictive models, conduct statistical analysis, and design experiments to derive insights and inform business decisions. Stay up-to-date with the latest data science techniques and tools and proactively identify opportunities to apply them to client projects. Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure successful delivery of data-driven solutions. Requirements Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree in Data Science, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field. At least five years of experience in data science, machine learning, and statistical modelling. Strong programming skills in Python. Experience with databases and SQL or other data storage technologies. Experience in delivering ML models into production environments. Proven ability to lead data science projects and deliver successful outcomes for clients. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Deep understanding of corporate AI processes and governance procedures. Passionate about the potential of AI and its business implications. A growth mindset in your approach to your work and career. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Located in Melbourne and eligible to work in Australia. Benefits  If you are a highly skilled and experienced data scientist professional with a track record of delivering data-driven solutions to complex business problems and a passion for providing strategic guidance to clients, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. We offer competitive compensation packages, flexible work practices, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and a focus on our people’s well-being to drive innovation and entrepreneurship.   Only relevant candidates will receive a response.  Show moreReport

Work type: Max Term Location: Brisbane Job type: Data & Analytics Applications close: Advanced Analytics Specialist (Project) Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. We’re on a mission to make flying better than ‘nice’. And to do that, it takes a team of talented people who are passionate about customer experience, doing the right thing always, with a focus on safety – in the air, on the ground and in our workplaces. A team who values real diversity and inclusion, in a big brand with big ambitions.  What you’ll be doing:  This is a Brisbane based, Maximum-Term contract until June 2024, where you will predominantly be working on a project. Towards the conclusion of the project, we will seek to find you an available permanent role with us. This Project will run for 6-9 months and have a 3-month post implementation ramp-up phase, where the SME’s become the critical resources to ensure ongoing adoption of the new tools. The products being implemented are complex systems using scientific models and require depth of insights into the AI & ML models, to ensure the systems deliver the intended value, which at full run rate is expected to deliver millions of dollars of value.  Advanced Analytics general responsibilities:  Utilize a variety of statistical and analytic methods to generate data models to help predict and explain commercial and operational trends to senior leadership and other division stakeholders. Perform ad hoc analysis to support multiple departments by compiling historical data as well as forecasting future trends. Research and evaluate industry trends, practices, and operational methodologies to continually improve overall company operational philosophy and performance. Collaborate with stakeholders to validate and improve existing assumptions and processes. Communicate informed conclusions and recommendations to senior leadership to improve business processes. Champion a culture of analytics and serve as a centre of excellence for trusted data integrity and analysis needs.  You’ll be great in this role if you have:  Minimum of 4 years’ experience in Advanced Analytics Previous data science and operations research experience. Previous project experience Ability to take complex mathematical concepts and communicate business relevance to key business stakeholders from front-line operations up to executive level management. Ability to write database queries for successful data analysis. Use of machine learning on large data sets to identify drivers and make predictions. Creation of optimisation models to reduce cost and increase revenue. Advanced Excel based user including Power Query & PowerPivot. Modelling languages such as PowerBI, DAX, R, Python, and SQL. Ability to create various predictive and operational models as required. Simulation models including Monte Carlo and Discrete Event. Experience with EMSR optimisation and other airline operations research is highly desirable.  We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to):  Discounted flights for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year) A flexible, hybrid work style. Work from home or the office, adapt your location to suit your style and needs One of Brisbane’s most admired head office locations, with South Bank train station, a supermarket, pharmacy, and lunch options downstairs plus a 5-minute walk to the Busway, a rooftop restaurant and onsite gym (with a low membership fee) and South Bank Parklands just across the road Discounts on travel insurance, lounge membership, car hire, accommodation, and experiences worldwide Cheaper hospitality, retail, technology, beauty and wellness services Free counselling and access to a wellbeing app to support your physical, mental, social and financial health ‘Dress for Your Day’ – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever makes you feel great for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you.  When everyone is included, everyone wins  We’re all individuals. And we love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQI+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.  Ready to apply?  We’re ready to hear from you.Show moreReport
